block.p: Anne Elizabeth Healy and Robert Michael Pollak were married last evening at the Chart House, a restaurant in Weehawken, N.J. Ethan Greenberg, an acting State Supreme Court Justice in the Bronx, officiated.
The bride and bridegroom, both 29, met at Hamilton College, from which they graduated.

Anne Elizabeth Healy and Robert Michael Pollak were married last evening at the Chart House, a restaurant in Weehawken, N.J. Ethan Greenberg, an acting State Supreme Court Justice in the Bronx, officiated.

Anne Elizabeth Healy and Robert Michael Pollak were married last evening at the Chart House, a restaurant in Weehawken, N.J. Ethan Greenberg, an acting State Supreme Court Justice in the Bronx, officiated.
The bride and bridegroom, both 29, met at Hamilton College, from which they graduated.
Mrs. Pollak was until last month a sales representative at the Celgene Corporation, a biopharmaceutical company in Summit, N.J. She is studying for an M.B.A. at New York University.

She is a daughter of Ellen M. Healy and James D. Healy of Leonia, N.J. Her father is the administration director at Manpower Demonstration Research Corporation, a nonprofit social policy research organization in Manhattan. Her mother works in Manhattan as a regional manager at Bright Horizons Family Solutions of Watertown, Mass., which provides work-site child care.
Mr. Pollak is studying for a law degree at Fordham. In October, he is to join Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom, the New York law firm, as an associate in the white-collar-crime department.

He is the son of Jane Pollak and Bernard Pollak of Norwalk, Conn. His mother is the author of ''Soul Proprietor: 100 Lessons From a Lifestyle Entrepreneur'' (Crossing Press, 2001). His father retired as the English department chairman at Byram Hills High School in Armonk, N.Y.
